cot.content:
To solve the problem, Please think and reason step by step, then answer.
question:
who played the first nfl thursday night football game
        
Generation Format:
Reasoning process:
Answer:

Reasoning process:
To determine who played in the first NFL Thursday Night Football game, we need to look at the history of the Thursday Night Football series. The NFL introduced Thursday Night Football in 2006 as a way to provide more games for fans and to increase viewership. The inaugural game took place on November 23, 2006, which was Thanksgiving Day. 

In that game, the Denver Broncos faced the Kansas City Chiefs. This matchup was significant as it was part of the Thanksgiving tradition of the NFL, but it also marked the beginning of a series of games that would be played on Thursday nights throughout the season in subsequent years.

Answer:
The first NFL Thursday Night Football game was played between the Denver Broncos and the Kansas City Chiefs on November 23, 2006.

anchoring.content:
You are a cognitive scientist, to answer the following question:
who played the first nfl thursday night football game
I will provide you with several retrieved passages:
Passages:
['BULLET::::- September 21, 1970 - The first ever Monday Night Football game is played, with the Browns defeating the New York Jets.\n', 'BULLET::::- November 20, 1972: RFK Stadium hosts its first "Monday Night Football" game. The Washington Redskins defeat the Atlanta Falcons 24-13.\n', "Deshaun Watson started his first NFL game for the Texans against the Bengals on Thursday Night Football. Watson scored the team's only touchdown of the game on a 49-yard run while the Bengals failed to score a touchdown.\n", 'When "Thursday Night Football" premiered, veteran television announcer Bryant Gumbel served as play-by-play announcer, with former Fox and current NBC analyst Cris Collinsworth serving as color commentator for the broadcasts. Collinsworth won the Sports Emmy for best game analyst for his work on the NFL Network telecasts. Dick Vermeil replaced Collinsworth for two games in 2006; Marshall Faulk and Deion Sanders replaced Collinsworth when needed in 2007.\n', 'When "Thursday Night Football" was added to the NFL schedule permanently, Westwood One created a specific broadcast team to cover it. From 2006 until 2008, Dick Enberg was the play-by-play man. Sam Wyche was the initial color analyst, and Dennis Green replaced him after the 2006 season.\n']

BULLET::::- September 21, 1970 - The first ever Monday Night Football game is played, with the Browns defeating the New York Jets.
BULLET::::- November 20, 1972: RFK Stadium hosts its first "Monday Night Football" game. The Washington Redskins defeat the Atlanta Falcons 24-13.
Deshaun Watson started his first NFL game for the Texans against the Bengals on Thursday Night Football. Watson scored the team's only touchdown of the game on a 49-yard run while the Bengals failed to score a touchdown.
When "Thursday Night Football" premiered, veteran television announcer Bryant Gumbel served as play-by-play announcer, with former Fox and current NBC analyst Cris Collinsworth serving as color commentator for the broadcasts. Collinsworth won the Sports Emmy for best game analyst for his work on the NFL Network telecasts. Dick Vermeil replaced Collinsworth for two games in 2006; Marshall Faulk and Deion Sanders replaced Collinsworth when needed in 2007.
When "Thursday Night Football" was added to the NFL schedule permanently, Westwood One created a specific broadcast team to cover it. From 2006 until 2008, Dick Enberg was the play-by-play man. Sam Wyche was the initial color analyst, and Dennis Green replaced him after the 2006 season.
